revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: "To my lord Hermes, my father, Kopres, greetings. Before all things I pray for your health and I make daily obeisance for you in presence of our ancestral gods. Therefore now I wrote to you at another time about the sorrow which took hold of all because of my overseer Hermation. Therefore now come out and bring me resin and spattles to work with and the basket which he told you. I pray for your good health. In margine sinistra: Bring me sandals.";(Verso): "Copres to Hermes, his father. Deliver to Hermes from Copres."

listBibl.bibl: Sijpesteijn PJ, Misc Pap Roca-Puig, 313-6, 1987, Plate -- SB XVIII, 13613 -- BL IX, 303 (l. 7-8); BL X, 221 (l. 5; 8; 9; 10-11) Chapa J, Acts of the 20th Intern. Congress of Papyrologists, 525-533, 1994 -- l. 8: alpha after the lacuna is very doubtful; l. 10:lambda not there at end of line (checked on original by Traianos Gagos).
